thread.title: School football: Harrison, Campbells share Lions spotlight
thread.title_full: School football: Harrison, Campbells share Lions spotlight

author: Cape Cod Times sports@capecodonline.com
title: School football: Harrison, Campbells share Lions spotlight
text: Posted Oct. 2, 2015 at 10:56 PM By Cape Cod Times Posted Oct. 2, 2015 at 10:56 PM » Social News CHELMSFORD - Sophomore Devan Harrison threw two touchdown passes to the Campbell brothers and St. John Paul II defeated Lowell Catholic, 28-8, on Friday night at McCarthy Stadium. Harrison’s first scoring pass, a 10-yard pass to junior Cole Campbell, and Jake Catarius’ two-point conversion rush gave the Lions (3-1 and in the Central Catholic Small) a 16-0 lead late in the second quarter. Lowell Catholic (1-3, 1-2 Central Catholic Small) cut the margin to 16-8 with a score just before the half off an interception but that would be all SJP II would allow. Harrison connected with junior Keith Campbell early in the fourth quarter with a 5-yard strike, giving the Lions a 22-8 lead. Senior Johnny Warden completed the scoring with an 11-yard touchdown run. Harrison got the St. John Paul II offense going with a 2-yard touchdown run in the opening quarter, hitting Warden for the two-point conversion pass and an 8-0 lead. Catarius tallied 55 yards on 10 carries while the St. John Paul II defense came a touchdown shy of its second straight shutout. Catarius had seven tackles on defense while both Cole and Keith Campbell hauled in an interception. Cohasset 21, Mashpee 6: Senior Chris Norton ran for 222 yards on 12 carries, running in a pair of scores to lead the defending Div. 6 State champion Skippers over the Falcons in Cohasset. Norton ran in scores of 54-yards and 22-yards to help Cohasset improve to 3-1, 2-0 in the South Shore League Small. Mashpee is 2-2, 1-1 in the league. Senior Deshaun Dias cut the Skippers lead to 14-6 with a 1-yard touchdown run in the third quarter. Norton then added his second touchdown, in the fourth quarter, to seal the win. By Cape Cod Times
